description: Demolition of the existing bungalow and erection of a two storey, part single storey detached four bedroom house
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (PL-01, PL-02 Rev. A, PL-03 Rev. A, PL-04 Rev. B, PL-05 Rev. B, PL-06 Rev. B, Asgard bike, motorcycle & garden storage, Energy and Sustainability Statement issue V2 dated 12/03/2021, Appendix A - Consideration of Renewable Technology, Appendix B - Water Usage Report, SAP WorkSheet: New dwelling design stage Green ASHP, SAP WorkSheet: New dwelling design stage Baseline & Lean - received 12th March 2021.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any Order amending or revoking and re-enacting that Order), planning permission shall be required in respect of development falling within Classes A, B, C, D and E of Schedule 2 Part 1 to that Order.
Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the local area and the amenity of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 and CC2 and to prevent overdevelopment of an already constrained site.

Condition : 4 - Prior to commencement of development above ground level (excluding demolition) hereby approved, details and samples of all facing materials are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.
Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the site, the local area and streetscene in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 and CC2.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved. Furthermore, the measures set out in the Energy Statement shall be put into effect, with evidence supplied (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) to the local planning authority to demonstrate that this has been done, before the dwelling is first occupied.
Reason: To ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions in accordance with London Plan Policy 5.2 and the London Borough of Hounslow Local Plan Policy EQ1.

Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of development above ground level (excluding demolition), details of hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted details shall include hard surfacing material; plant schedules noting species, sizes and numbers/densities. The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: In the interest of biodiversity, sustainability and to ensure a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 and CC2.

Condition : 7 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, details of boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The submitted details to include materials, dimensions and siting of boundary treatments. The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: In the interest of visual amenity and to safeguard the amenity of neighbouring and future occupiers of the site in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 and CC2.

Condition : 8 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, the site's existing vehicular crossover from Hibernia Road shall be permanently closed and the footway and full-height kerb reinstated to ensure that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement. (Note: These works can only be carried out by an approved Council contractor and you should contact Hounslow Highways to arrange for the work to be carried out.)
Reason: To enhance the pedestrian environment and improve highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with Local Plan Policy EC2.

Condition : 9 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, the two Asgard cycle stores as shown on the approved plans shall be provided for the future occupiers and maintained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the adequate provision of secure cycle parking for future occupiers in accordance with Local Plan policy EC2.

Condition : 10 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, details of waste and recycling storage designed in accordance with the Council's Recycling and Refuse Guidance: Guide for Architects and Planners shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented in full and retained thereafter.
Waste and recycling bins shall be placed for collection within the frontage of the site only and not on the public highway.
Reason: To safeguard the appearance and environmental quality of the local area and in the interest of public health and highway safety in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1, CC2, EC2 and EQ7.

Condition : 11 - Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, evidence (eg photographs of materials in-situ and/or copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been implemented in accordance with the following:
i.	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows, roofs, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) achieved a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide specification.
ii.	At least 50% of timber and timber products were sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
iii.	No construction or insulation materials were used which release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials in accordance with Local Plan policy EQ2.

Condition : 12 - Prior to occupation of the hereby approved development, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers' literature) demonstrating that the development of that phase has been constructed to achieve an internal water consumption by the development not exceeding 105 litres/person/day in line with The Water Efficiency Calculator for new dwellings issued by the Ministry for Housing, Communities and Local Government, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure the overall environmental sustainability of the development in accordance with Local Plan Policy EQ2 and the London Plan.

Condition : 13 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
